meanings.definition: To move or transfer (something) to another place or situation.
meanings.sent1: She transplanted the flowers from the garden to the pots.
meanings.sent2: The farmer transplanted the crops to a sunnier field.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel transplanted the acorns to different hiding spots.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas transplanted seamlessly into the new project.
meanings.sent5: The teacher transplanted knowledge into the young minds.

meanings.definition: To uproot and replant (a plant or tree) in another place.
meanings.sent1: He carefully transplanted the rose bush to the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The gardener transplanted the shrubs to create a new landscape design.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat transplanted the potted plant to the top shelf.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood transplanted her back to simpler times.
meanings.sent5: The transplanting of the tree symbolized growth and change.

meanings.definition: To transfer (tissue or an organ) from one body or part to another.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon transplanted the healthy kidney into the patient's body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors can now successfully transplant organs to save lives.
meanings.sent3: The chef jokingly tried to transplant the taste of one dish into another.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was transplanted into the hearts of everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The music transplanted joy into the listeners' souls.
